title: Kanjuruhan Stadium
text:
Stadion Kanjuruhan is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Malang%20Regency">Malang Regency</a>, <a href="East%20Java">East Java</a>, <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches. The stadium holds 42,449. It is home of <a href="Arema%20F.C.">Arema</a>, football team in <a href="Liga%201%20%28Indonesia%29">Liga 1</a>. It is also used by <a href="Persekam%20Metro%20F.C.">Persekam Metro Kabupaten Malang</a> of the <a href="Liga%203%20%28Indonesia%29">Liga 3</a>. 
History.
Stadium was built in 1997 with construction cost was estimated at <a href="Indonesian%20rupiah">Rp</a>35 billion. On 9 June 2004, the stadium was inaugurated for use by President <a href="Megawati%20Soekarnoputri">Megawati Soekarnoputri</a>. The inauguration of the stadium owned by the Malang Regency Government was marked by a trial match in the middle of the 2004 Indonesian First League Division between <a href="Arema%20F.C.">Arema</a> and <a href="PSS%20Sleman">PSS Sleman</a>. The first match at the Kanjuruhan Stadium ended in a 1-0 victory for Arema.
Renovations.
It was also renovated in 2010 for the purposes of the AFC Champions League in terms of adding lighting power.
